jobs.job_title: Head of SEO and Owned Media
jobs.description: Our mission is to open the door to the life changing impact of education and help make education accessible for all. As a nimble growth stage start up, we've emerged as the leading online education platform helping over 30 million learners and educators each month. Study.com has earned numerous awards and it has been recognized as one of the most transformational companies in EdTech, living up to our commitment to all learners: Breakthroughs Start Here. From students and educators in over 9,000 school districts that use Study.com, to working adults striving to complete their college degree or gain professional certifications, we empower them to reach their full potential. Our product is our impact! Across our college programs alone we have saved students over $200M in tuition and enabled tens of thousands to become nurses, teachers, accountants and more. Additionally, as part of our mission we’ve donated over $27 million across social impact programs to learners and educators. Study.com, a leading online education technology company, is seeking a seasoned Head of SEO and Owned Media to lead growing our expansive traffic footprint. Study.com helps over 30 million learners and educators each month. SEO has been a key part of our strategy since inception, requiring a sustained, company wide effort. We are looking for a strategic, hands on leader with a proven track record in managing large scale owned media and SEO strategies, including content, technical onsite, offsite SEO and brand. The ideal candidate will have a blend of technical expertise, creative content planning, and leadership skills to drive our visibility and audiences across for various segments of our business and millions of keywords. This role is based in our Mountain View, CA office and is hybrid in office Mondays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays. What You'll Do Develop and execute a comprehensive SEO strategy to increase organic search traffic, improve SERP rankings, and drive user engagement for our key direct to consumer business segments. Analyze and leverage data driven insights to identify growth opportunities and optimize content across multiple owned media platforms – including Google Search, YouTube, TikTok, forums and more. Conduct technical SEO audits and implement necessary changes to improve site architecture, performance, and other technical elements affecting SEO performance. Direct with cross functional teams, including content, marketing, product, and engineering, to help meet SEO goals which are aligned with company objectives. Develop and execute strategy to grow the brand, scale outreach and ultimately increase authority, relevant mentions and backlinks. Lead strategy and execution for LLM injection and staying relevant in a shifting SEO landscape (AI Overviews, ChatGPT Search, Perplexity, etc.) Lead, mentor, and grow the global owned media and SEO team, providing guidance, setting expectations and driving accountability to achieve team and company goals. Manage relationships with any SEO related external vendors or partners as needed. Stay updated with the latest SEO trends, Google algorithm updates, and industry best practices to ensure a competitive edge in search rankings. Optimize the use of machine learning tools, AI and AI agents / automation to enhance team efficiency across all parts of the SEO optimization workflow to maximize SEO performance at scale. Manage the team that is responsible for scaling Study.com’s ambassador and influencer program in owned media channels through strategic content initiatives and partners. Monitor, report, and analyze SEO and owned channels performance metrics, adjusting strategies as needed to achieve desired results. Leverage SEO to change the world and do well by doing good. What You'll Bring To The Role 15+ years of experience in SEO with a track record of successfully managing and growing high traffic websites (direct to consumer and SaaS experience a plus). Demonstrated mastery of “hands on” or “hands off” approaches as a leader. Know the details in your area while understanding the broader strategy to connect the dots quickly. Must be willing and able to lead a team as well as roll up their sleeves to get things done. Proven experience directly inspiring and managing high performance teams in a dynamic fast paced environment that requires executional excellence and speed. Strong understanding of ranking factors, search engine optimization practices, and content marketing strategies, including how AI impacts the future of SEO. High technical proficiency with SEO tools (e.g., SEMrush, Ahrefs, Moz, SimilarWeb), web analytics and data analysis (Excel, Tableau, BigQuery). Experience with AI and machine learning applications in SEO and content marketing. Excellent analytical, organizational, and project management skills. Strong communication and interpersonal abilities to effectively collaborate all levels and stakeholders. Ability to think creatively, strategically, and identify and resolve problems efficiently. The salary range for this position is $150,000 $190,000 per year. Pay and is dependent upon factors including skills, work experience, business needs, and market demands. At Study.com, We Know That Strong Communities Are Built On The Power Of Our Diversity, And We Respect And Strive To Understand For The Diverse Identities, Race, Ethnicities, Backgrounds, And Perspectives Of Our Team Members. Our Work And Company Culture Have Been Consistently Recognized, Including Inc. Best Place to Work Fortune Great Places to Work – Best Workplaces in the Bay Area Golden Bridge Awards – Gold Winner, Corporate Social Responsibility San Francisco Business Times & Silicon Valley Business Journal – Best Places to Work Study.com provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, veteran or disability status. In addition to federal law requirements. Study.com complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. Additionally, qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for the position in accordance with applicable state and local laws. show less

jobs.job_title: SEO/SEM & PPC MARKETING SPECIALIST (On-Site Work Only /No remote work)
jobs.description: Job Description TLF’s SEO / SEM & PPC Marketing Specialist you will drive brand awareness and sales via customer acquisition strategies for www.TLFapparel.com and TLF’s Custom App. As an expert in SEO / SEM & PPC marketing, D2C lifecycle marketing, ecommerce consumer goods and shopping, and conversion optimization, you will use your expert knowledge in web, marketing, branding, and media buying strategies via organic and paid search, PPC, SEO, and SEM to leverage best practice digital marketing and growth hacking techniques. This position will be responsible for daily/weekly/monthly campaign development, media buying, implementation, on site and offsite SEO and backlinking, while reporting the corresponding data and KPI’s for these initiatives to the marketing department, leadership, and CEO on a daily/weekly/monthly/quarterly/ and annual basis. Job Description (Including But Not Limited To The Below) POSITION ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES: Responsible for the day to day internal project planning, management, and scheduling of all digital marketing programs from conceptual development, campaign build out, media buying, through program delivery (publishing all digital marketing content in each platform) from top of funnel to bottom of funnel. Responsible for developing and executing well thought out digital marketing plans and creative content, including landing pages, sign up forms, customer data capturing, content marketing, SEO, video and image campaigns, copy, and CTA’s. Responsible for the development, management, and execution of a 7 figure annual adverting budget (operated with no less than a $350k a month digital marketing spend and budget). Create, implement, track, analyze and optimize large scale complex paid advertising campaigns on Google, Google Merchant and Shopping, Pinterest, X (Twitter), YouTube, Bing, Yahoo, Criteo and affiliate marketing platforms from top of funnel to bottom of funnel. Create, implement, track, analyze and optimize large scale complex digital marketing for all paid search (Google, Bing, Yahoo), Expert in Google Shopping and Google Merchant, Tiktok Shopping, X (Twitter) Shopping, Pinterest Shopping and catalog feeds and management. Expert in top of funnel to bottom of funnel for traffic, prospecting, acquisition, and retargeting, and ad spend management processes including daily reporting, performance analysis, bid and ROAS optimization. Track and provide reports on all marketing KPI’s, including lead conversion and ROAS/ROI of all marketing programs Manage, track, analyze, and optimize Google Search Console, SEMrush, and Triple Whale, reporting, research, platform auditing, and KPI management Expert in setting up, maintaining, optimization, reporting, and tracking data across all areas of G4 Expert in GTM pixel/tag management (Google Tag Manager) and implementation on all platforms and TLFapparel.com, as well as mapping of 1st party data for media usage and audience segmentation, and analyze 1st and third party attribution for reporting and attribution accuracy Strategize, Manage, and Implement audits, ongoing keyword analysis, research and optimization, competitive analysis and benchmarking, on site and off site marketing and affiliate implementation and optimization strategies, and back link strategies. Responsible for creating storylines, copy, CTA’s, and subject lines; developing and optimizing audiences and LAL’s, audience segmentation, and overall strategy behind all digital campaigns using analytics and strong narratives and assets that bring to life the company’s brand voice and messaging. Create project briefs and execute strategy working in harmony with creative designers, video production teams, and web team regarding the creation and deployment of all digital marketing campaigns and strategies and content/assets and on and offsite SEO needs, while developing timelines and ensuring the overall quality of the all initiatives. Create and deliver weekly, monthly, and quarterly reporting on campaign performance QUALIFICATIONS / SKILLS / REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Computer Science, or a related field Must have 3 year’s experience with Shopify Plus for ecommerce shopping and Hydrogen and Headless sites on Shopify’s Platform Highly proficient in web design, web optimization, H1 H5 tags , onsite and off site SEO, SEM, backlinking, and competitive benchmarking Must have managed and personally published, executed, and optimized a 7 figure annual budget for digital platforms (including but not limited to FB, IG, TikTok, YouTube, Google, Bind, Yahoo, X(Twitter), Pinterest, and Google Merchant and Shopping and operated with no less than a $350k a month digital marketing spend and budget withing the last 2 years Must have 7 years of experience in e commerce marketing and ecommerce shopping, paid and organic social, digital advertising, and SEO/SEM/PPC Must have 7 years of experience with apps and tools (such as: Google Analytics/ GA4, Google Search Console, Google Trends, Google Tag Manager, SEMrush, Triple Whale, Ecommerce Store Apps, Shopify, etc) Certified Google Analytics and Google Adwords Must have no less than 3 recent years experience in D2C consumer marketing, full funnel optimization Strong experience using Google Search Console, Google Trends Strong experience with bid management tools Strong Experience with A/B and multivariate experiments Up to date with the latest trends and best practices in SEO and SEM and search engine algorithms and use of AI and ChatGTP Excellent understanding of pixel implementation and tracking URL’s Expert skills with Microsoft Excel (must be comfortable analyzing large quantities of data utilizing advanced Excel formulas) Experience with creative design and Web Design, UX/UI, Adobe XD, Photoshop, Illustrator, and video production Strong quantitative, analytical and problem solving skills Proven record of business analysis driven and fact based decision making Highly productive and efficient with excellent time management skills Strong attention to detail, excellent organization skills, and ability to manage multiple projects/responsibilities through completion with minimal supervision Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to influence and persuade others with diplomacy and tact Company Description TLF was established in 2012 as a premium athletic and lifestyle apparel brand, pioneering a new category of Gym To Street® Wear products engineered for your toughest training sessions, designed to carry you through the rest of your day for wherever life takes you. Our mission is to provide products designed to push the limits of innovation and human performance to the highest possible level via fit, wearability, and functionality while simultaneously providing an exclusive sense of style and unparalleled quality. Our products are distributed and sold globally direct to consumers via TLFapparel.com and our TLF App. Join our team and work in a fun, fast paced, energetic environment with endless potential for individual and professional career growth. Our company culture does not micromanage its team members. Instead, we thrive on empowering people to be self motivated professionals who challenge themselves to work harder, smarter, and more efficiently as individuals and as part of a team. This winning formula creates a culture that inspires individuals and team members to continually set new and unprecedented goals that will continue to drive TLF to become a global leader in Gym To Street® Wear. What are you waiting for? Join the TLF “FAM“ and create a lasting career that will never feel like a job but instead like you are fulfilling a passion that will make history! Let’s REDEFINE IMPOSSIBLE® and TAKE LIFE FURTHER® together. BENEFITS (for full time employees only): Medical Dental Vision A free gym membership to TLF’s state of the art gym (aka TLF TRAINING LAB®) Access perks (A discounted database that offers a network of consumer perks) Chill, refuel, and recharge in our awesome employee lounge (unlimited coffee and tea) PS5 stations for gamers A monthly product allowance ($100) for our premium Gym To Street® Wear Continued education programs & training Employee team building events TIME OFF BENEFITS (for full time employees only): Vacation: 2 weeks a year (accrued at a rate of 3.08 per pay period) Sick Days: 6 days a year (accrued at a rate of 1.85 per pay period) Personal Days (PTO’s) 4 days a year (1 day accrued every quarter) 9 Paid Holidays 1 Floating Holiday (a day of your choosing) PART TIME/INTERN BENEFITS: TLF is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity at our company. We don't discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. jobs.description: Description This is an exciting role which involves complete ownership of Search Engine Optimization for Amazon Flex globally. The successful candidate will create and lead a strategy to improve Amazon Flex rankings on search engines, identifying critical customer needs and gaps and working with internal stakeholders and regional teams to share these learnings. Responsibilities will span unpaid channels, and require the review of past data and trends in order to continually iterate strategy. You will demonstrate an ability to clearly communicate to the right target audience, and be in charge of developing and deploying online content at both a global and regional level. You will work extremely closely with regional marketing teams to ensure that content or optimizations are tailored for the right audience. A successful candidate will have experience in leading and executing a SEO strategy either in house or agency side. You will be an analytical thinker who loves solving problems and strives to provide an excellent customer experience from the first interaction with the Amazon Flex website. The candidate will be customer obsessed and focused on delivering results with clear ROI. Excellent skills in Excel are also a required. This role is based out of Seattle. NYC can be considered as needed. Key job responsibilities Build an SEO strategy, focusing on growing Amazon Flex’s organic reach across our regions and showing how you will deploy content to acquire our target audiences within our unique delivery areas. Write and deploy original content for the Amazon Flex website, tailored for the right audience. Scope third party applications to support with SEO tasks, provide training to worldwide marketing stakeholders. Be the SME on Amazon Flex customer search behavior, needs and gaps and work with internal stakeholders to enhance the customer experience in other areas of the business. Monitor Delivery Partner sentiment in specific regions and act as the expert on their needs, including communicating back to the larger Amazon Flex team. Constantly check search results, ranking and analytics to monitor performance and make recommendations for improvements. Keep up to date with ever changing algorithm updates. Work with internal teams to share and learn best practices, and drive results between marketplaces. Collaborate with technical partner teams to explain and prioritize technical issues. A day in the life About The Team At Amazon, we're working to be the most Customer centric company on earth. One customer experience that we’re constantly looking to take to a new level is how we fulfill and deliver orders. Our goal is to exceed the expectations of all our customers by ensuring that their orders, no matter how large or small, are delivered where and when they need them, as quickly, accurately, and cost effectively as possible. To meet this goal, Amazon is continually striving to innovate and provide best in class service levels through the introduction of pioneering new products and services in the last mile delivery space. We are doing this by building a world class last mile operation, significantly complimented by Amazon Flex. Amazon Flex works directly with independent contractors – called delivery partners – to make deliveries to our customers. With Amazon Flex, individuals can now be their own boss delivering Amazon packages. Basic Qualifications 4+ years of proven experience in SEO strategy and execution, including technical SEO, content optimization, and link building. Proficiency in SEO tools such as Google Analytics/Adobe Analytics, Google Search Console, Ahrefs, SEMrush, Screaming Frog, or similar. Strong understanding of technical SEO, including crawling, indexing, and rendering, with experience conducting and resolving SEO audits. Strong ability to analyze SEO performance data and translate insights into actionable recommendations. Understanding of international SEO concepts such as hreflang tags and optimizing for multilingual/multiregional sites. Proven ability to manage multiple SEO projects simultaneously while collaborating with cross functional teams Preferred Qualifications Hands on experience managing SEO for multi site or international websites. Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how we hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner. Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $98,200/year in our lowest geographic market up to $179,600/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site. Company Amazon.com Services LLC Job ID: A2853616 show less

jobs.description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts. Job Category Marketing & Communications Job Details About Salesforce We’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right place. Slack is seeking a passionate and driven Senior SEO Manager to join our growing marketing team. In this role, you will play a critical part in developing and executing our global SEO strategy, driving organic growth across multiple regions. You are a highly analytical and collaborative individual with a proven track record of success in international SEO. You thrive in a fast paced environment and possess exceptional communication skills to effectively collaborate with cross functional teams. Responsibilities Global SEO Roadmap Ownership: Lead the development and execution of Slack's global SEO roadmap, collaborating closely with regional content teams and agencies to prioritize initiatives and drive organic growth. Collaboration & Strategy: Partner with product teams to ensure SEO requirements are integrated into the product roadmap, safeguarding SEO investments and advocating for organic search within the organization. Data Driven Decision Making: Utilize data to prioritize SEO initiatives, track performance, and measure the impact of improvements across regions. Continuously monitor industry trends and competitive landscapes to refine SEO strategies. Standardization & Best Practices: Establish and disseminate SEO best practices and guidelines across regions, ensuring consistency and alignment among teams. Performance Metrics: Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) for SEO, working with regional teams to monitor progress and report on the health of technical SEO through audits and performance analysis. Cross Functional Leadership: Lead and motivate cross functional teams, fostering a collaborative environment to achieve shared goals. Effectively manage resources and scope to maintain project momentum and deliver results. Effective Communication: Communicate clearly and concisely with stakeholders at all levels, ensuring seamless collaboration and efficient resource allocation. Requirements 5+ Years of SEO Experience: Deep understanding of SEO methodologies, best practices, and industry trends, with a minimum of 5 years of hands on experience. International SEO Experience: Demonstrated success in managing and executing SEO strategies across multiple geographic regions, with a strong understanding of regional search nuances and cultural considerations. Multilingual SEO: Experience managing SEO for websites in different languages, including those you may not be fluent in. Hands on Approach: Willingness to "roll up your sleeves" and perform tasks such as on page optimization, content editing, and technical SEO analysis. Exceptional Project Management Skills: Proven ability to multitask, prioritize effectively, and manage multiple projects simultaneously to meet deadlines in a fast paced environment. Data Driven Approach: Strong analytical skills with the ability to leverage data to inform decisions, measure performance, and identify opportunities for improvement. Collaboration & Communication: Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to build strong cross functional relationships and effectively convey complex information to both technical and non technical audiences. Technical Proficiency: Hands on experience with SEO tools such as SEMrush, Ahrefs, BrightEdge, and Screaming Frog. Bonus Points Experience working in the SaaS industry. Familiarity with agile methodologies. Benefits Competitive salary and benefits package. Opportunity to work on a globally recognized platform. Collaborative and supportive work environment. Be a part of a company that is changing the way the world works. If you are a passionate SEO professional with a proven track record of success and a desire to make a significant impact, we encourage you to apply! Accommodations If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form. Posting Statement At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at www.equality.com and explore our company benefits at www.salesforcebenefits.com. Salesforce is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce will not pay any third party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce. Salesforce welcomes all. For Colorado based roles, the base salary hiring range for this position is $136,600 to $187,900. For Illinois based roles, the base salary hiring range for this position is $150,300 to $206,700. Compensation offered will be determined by factors such as location, level, job related knowledge, skills, and experience. Certain roles may be eligible for incentive compensation, equity, benefits. More details about our company benefits can be found at the following link: https://www.salesforcebenefits.com. show less

jobs.description: When you join Verizon You want more out of a career. A place to share your ideas freely — even if they’re daring or different. Where the true you can learn, grow, and thrive. At Verizon, we power and empower how people live, work and play by connecting them to what brings them joy. We do what we love — driving innovation, creativity, and impact in the world. Our V Team is a community of people who anticipate, lead, and believe that listening is where learning begins. In crisis and in celebration, we come together — lifting our communities and building trust in how we show up, everywhere & always. Want in? Join the V Team Life. What You’ll Be Doing... The Verizon Consumer Group is looking for a passionate SEO Strategist to join our growing and dynamic team. The role would be supporting the consumer home internet business by optimizing site experiences including on page, technical, and off page strategies and tactics. In addition to a deep understanding of all aspects of search engine optimization, the position also requires partnership across several marketing, design, and development teams to ensure search is at the forefront of the website strategy. The ideal candidate should be a data first marketer, who is comfortable supporting the creation and execution of large scale strategic initiatives for verizon.com. This is a rare opportunity to help pave the digital future for an innovative and integral brand. Responsibilities Include Supporting cohesive, compelling SEO strategies that guide the development & content processes. This may include site crawls, content audits, linking strategies, redirect mapping, local, and data analysis of site performance. Providing actionable insights for site improvement based on data and competitive gap analysis. Measuring and reporting out on the effectiveness of organic and marketing strategies and performance. Performing keyword research and on page optimizations for key marketing landing pages, articles, and ecommerce pages. Communicating strategic visions to internal stakeholders and partnering across business units, including merchandising, design, development, and IT teams. Managing product and project launches across the organization, including creating tickets, performing QAs, and keeping track of several fast moving pieces. Establishing and promoting SEO guidelines, best practices, and standards across business units, as well as expanding relationship with paid search for holistic search opportunities. Maintaining expert level understanding of latest industry trends, guidelines, and algorithm changes including AI, SGE, Helpful Content Updates, and more. What We’re Looking For You’ll need to have: Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience. Four or more years of relevant experience required, demonstrated through work experience and/or military experience. Experience creating, presenting, and managing multiple SEO data and analysis projects at once. Experience with SEO tools to inform SEO strategy including but not limited to Google Sheets, Google Search Console, Adobe Analytics (Omniture), Looker Studio (Google Data Studio), SEMRush, SimilarWebPro, Ahrefs, Botify, and Screaming Frog. Experience communicating the value Search, Branding, Content, and IA have on KPIs and business drivers. Experience in measurement of both organic and paid search data. Even Better If You Have Marketing/agency/consultative services experience in SEO. Strong written and verbal communication skills, including email, presentations, and slide decks. If Verizon and this role sound like a fit for you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every “even better” qualification listed above. Where you’ll be working In this hybrid role, you'll have a defined work location that includes work from home and a minimum eight assigned office days per month that will be set by your manager. Scheduled Weekly Hours 40 Equal Employment Opportunity We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and celebrate our employees’ differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. At Verizon, we know that diversity makes us stronger. We are committed to a collaborative, inclusive environment that encourages authenticity and fosters a sense of belonging. We strive for everyone to feel valued, connected, and empowered to reach their potential and contribute their best. Check out our diversity and inclusion page to learn more. Our benefits are designed to help you move forward in your career, and in areas of your life outside of Verizon. From health and wellness benefits, short term incentives, 401(k) Savings Plan, stock incentive programs, paid time off, parental leave, adoption assistance and tuition assistance, plus other incentives, we’ve got you covered with our award winning total rewards package. For part timers, your coverage will vary as you may be eligible for some of these benefits depending on your individual circumstances. If you are hired into a California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Illinois, Maryland, Minnesota, Nevada, New York, Rhode Island, Washington or Washington, D.C. work location, the compensation range for this position is between $89,000.00 and $166,000.00 annually based on a full time schedule. The salary will vary depending on your location and confirmed job related skills and experience. This is an incentive based position with the potential to earn more. For part time roles, your compensation will be adjusted to reflect your hours. show less

jobs.description: 🚀 About PermitFlow PermitFlow’s mission is to streamline and simplify construction permitting in the $1.6 trillion United States construction market. Our software reduces time to permit, supporting permitting end to end including permit research, application preparation, submission, and monitoring. We’ve raised a $31m Series A led by Kleiner Perkins with participation from Initialized Capital, Y Combinator, Felicis Ventures, Altos Ventures, and the founders and executives from Zillow, PlanGrid, Thumbtack, Bluebeam, Uber, Procore, and more. Our team consists of architects, structural engineers, permitting experts, and workflow software specialists, all who have personally experienced the pain of permitting. ✋ Who you are? The Director, Content Marketing & SEO is a pivotal role responsible for creating and driving our full content strategy. This position requires an individual with strong experience in both content management and SEO in addition to a strong comfort with data. We’re looking for a strategic problem solver who is data driven, pragmatic, and process driven. You should be ready and excited to be a hands on operator, executing tactically as well as strategically. The Director will manage contracted content writers and other contractors, ensuring their efforts support the larger content and SEO vision. Tactically, this means owning keyword research, building a pipeline of relevant content ideas, and setting up our writers for success. This also means reviewing / copyediting content, posting content, and tracking results. As critical as tactical execution is a a willingness to experiment with AI and other novel data centric content strategies. We have a strong hypothesis that this individual will be able to have an outsized impact on the business via savvy adoption of new tools and techniques. We’re looking for a curious, driven tinkerer excited to design and run content / SEO experiments before formalizing long term programs around the most successful ones. ✅ What You’ll Do: Develop content strategies to further our position as thought leaders in the permitting space, making strategic decisions around channel, format, content, and more Own our SEO and website strategy, including keyword research, site architecture, and metrics tracking (incl. pipeline growth) Work with demand generation to identify and create content pieces serving the full marketing funnel, different personas, and campaigns Experiment with new content formats and channels (ex. webinars, customer interviews, video testimonials) Experiment and incorporate new technology and methodologies into our content and SEO programs, such as generative AI and programmatic SEO Create and develop our brand voice in such a way that our ICP and broader addressable market trust PermitFlow as a thought leader and source of truth Build and drive our content engine, creating a process for consistently producing high quality content pieces (likely involving a small group of freelance writers and contractors) Act as a copyeditor and reviewer to ensure high quality of external facing communications Communicate with sales and other departments to identity new content requirements, developing and executing on content in support of key campaigns and channels Stay apprised of the latest content marketing and SEO tactics and approaches to ensure our marketing remains fresh and ahead of the competition Report on key content and SEO metrics to track performance and identify opportunities to improve 🙌 Qualifications & Fit: Professional Background: 3+ years of experience supporting content and inbound strategies for B2B SaaS companies. Curiosity: Both SEO and Content are iterative programs. We’re looking for someone creative, proactive, and curious excited to experiment and push boundaries. Strong quant inclination: You can’t improve what you can’t measure. You love numbers, and you’re very comfortable in data tools. Strong communicator: Driven to "cut through the noise" with thoughtful, memorable and differentiating messages. Strong work ethic: You have the opportunity to build and lead a function as we grow. Motivated by a fast paced environment. Team player: Your success will be tied closely to the success of the functions you’re supporting. Seeing your success as their success is critical! NYC Based: This role is a hybrid role, with in person required Monday, Wednesday, and Friday in our Manhattan office. 💙 Benefits 📈 Equity packages 💰 Competitive Salary 🩺 100% Paid health, dental & vision coverage 🍽️ Lunch & Dinner provided w/ a fully stocked kitchen 🚍 Commuter benefits 🎤 Team building events 🌴 Unlimited PTO Compensation Range: $120K $160K show less
